tasks.task: Drive a 4-wheeled articulated wagon behind a tractor to cart hay from the field.
subtasks: Sit in the tractor seat and engage the transmission.
Operate the tractor to tow the 4-wheeled articulated wagon.
Guide the tractor and wagon as they travel from the field to the storage area.
Ensure that the hay is loaded properly onto the wagon.
Secure the hay load on the wagon to prevent shifting during transport.
Transfer control of the wagon's brakes and steering to the helper via a wheel or lever.
Monitor the helper’s (who is sitting in the wagon) operation of the hay lift.
Adjust the tractor's speed as necessary based on the helper's need to raise or lower the hay fork.
Drive the tractor and wagon back to the farmyard or storage area.

tasks.task: Hand guide a hay fork with a helper.
subtasks: Sit on the front seat of the 4-wheeled articulated wagon.
Hold the hay fork while the tractor pulls the wagon across the field.
Position the hay fork between rows of standing hay.
Push or pull the hay fork to lift the hay into the air.
Guide the fork to direct the hay onto the wagon bed.
Release the hay on the wagon bed and reset the fork for the next load.
Communicate with the tractor driver to coordinate the timing of raising and lowering the fork.
Ensure that the hay is placed safely and efficiently on the wagon.

tasks.task: Load hay onto the tractor-drawn wagon.
subtasks: Wait for the wagon to be positioned below the raised hay fork.
Grasp the hay as it is deposited from the fork.
Arrange the hay on the wagon bed in a stable, secure pile.
Stomp or pack down the hay to optimize storage space and prevent sifting during transport.
Remove any loose debris or pieces not suitable for storage.
Stand clear of moving parts when the hay is being lifted or placed.
Load hay in a manner that allows safe transportation to the storage area.

tasks.task: Secure hay onto the wagon bed.
subtasks: Once the hay is loaded, spread it evenly across the wagon's flatbed.
Use baling twine, straps, or bungee cords to tie down the hay load.
Check the security of the bindings to prevent hay from shifting during transport.
Adjust any overhanging hay to ensure balance and safety.
Cover the load if necessary to protect from weather elements during transport.

tasks.task: Unload hay from the wagon onto a designated storage area.
subtasks: Position the wagon at the designated unloading spot.
Release the hay from the bindings or wrap.
Push or hand unload the hay from the wagon bed.
Stack the hay in an organized,稳固方式 to maximize storage capacity.
Ensure that the stacking is stable to prevent collapse.
Control any loose ends or edges of the hay pile to prevent injury.

tasks.task: Operate a forklift to transport hay.
subtasks: Drive the forklift to the field where hay is baled.
Select the appropriate forks for picking up the hay bales.
Approach a hay bale and lift it using the forklift.
Transport the hay bale to a designated unloading area.
Lower the bale onto the ground at the unloading area.
Repeat the process until all hay bales are moved.
Sit on the front seat of the hay wagon.
Assist in lifting the hay by using the hay fork.
Instruct the tractor driver regarding the right alignment for hay placement.
Communicate when the hay needs to be released at the optimal spot on the wagon.
Ensure that the hay is deposited in a manner that optimizes loading efficiency.
Adjust the fork's angle or position as needed during the loading process.
